alert.note: Alert for Jim Hogg; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 3:47AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jim Hogg and Zapata Counties through 430 AM CDT... At 346 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Oilton to near Aguilares to 9 miles southeast of El Cenizo to 20 miles northwest of San Ygnacio. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Zapata, Hebbronville, San Ygnacio, Bustamante, Medina, Zapata High School, Randado, Zapata Middle School, South Fork Estates and Siesta Shores. This includes US Highway 83 between mile markers 738 and 772. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
